thread.title: Former Jaguar Scobee feels wrath of social media after missed field goals
thread.title_full: Former Jaguar Scobee feels wrath of social media after missed field goals

title: Former Jaguar Scobee feels wrath of social media after missed field goals
text:
Scobee's Wikipedia page briefly changed to say 'unemployed kicker' Sponsored Links 
A new team and a new city hasn’t been smooth sailing for Josh Scobee, the longtime Jaguar who still holds the team record for scoring. Scobee missed two field goals for Pittsburgh Thursday night as the Steelers lost 23-20 in overtime to Baltimore. Scobee, who was traded in August for a future draft pick, is already feeling the wrath of Steelers fans on social media. “I feel like I let the team down,” Scobee told USA Today . “It’s a bad feeling. It was a hard fought game on both sides. I wish I had been able to come through, but it just wasn’t my night.”Scobee also was the focus of a postgame rant from rapper Snoop Dogg, who launched into a profanity-laced tirade after the game (see above). Scobee’s replacement, rookie Jason Myers, is 5-for-6 this season, including a 58-yarder. 
Some social media reaction Friday morning from Steelers fans: Talk about an all time back fire... Josh Scobee challenges Tiger Woods to 100k/hole last year and he's missed the most FG's in NFL since '14 — Michael J Murray (@_MichaelMurray_) October 2, 2015 Ravens MVP Thursday - Josh Scobee.
